titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Bob Witz Papers, circa early 1960s-2010 MSS.080
titlestmt.author: Daniel Sokolow in 1997. Updated in 2012 by Laura Newsome.

editionstmt.p: This version was derived from The Bob WitzPapers-Appearances Magazine Finding Aid.htm

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-11-22 16:52:44 -0500.

change.item: Updated by Shirin Khaki and Kristen Owens to include materials integrated from accession 2017.049, 2017.050, 2017.051, 2017.052, 2017.053 and 2001.080

physdesc.extent: in 6 record cartons, 2 flat boxes, 2 manuscript boxes, 7 oversize folders

did.abstract: Bob Witz is the editor of Appearances Magazine, a small arts magazine first published in the East Village during the 1980s. Witz is also an artist, writer and sculptor who lives in New York. The collection consists of material related to Appearances Magazine, correspondence, gallery catalogues and ephemera, sketchbooks, writings, chap books, drawings, and photographs.
did.physloc: Some materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Bob Witz Papers were donated to the Fales Library by Mr. Witz in the Fall of 1996. The accession number associated with the original donation is 1996.080. Multiple accretions to the collection were donated between 1997 and circa 2010. The accession numbers associated with these accretions are: 2001.080, 2006.080, 2009.080, 2014.080, 2015.080, 2017.049, 2017.050, 2017.051, 2017.052, 2017.053.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date (if known); Bob Witz Papers/Appearances Magazine; MSS 080; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Bob Witz is a painter/sculptor, writer, poet, and editor of Appearances Magazine. Appearances is a small, low-budget magazine which was started in the East Village and has been published from the 1980s to the present. It is devoted mostly to the art scene with a focus on the alternative currents of this scene. Witz also published/produced small chapbooks, including an early book by Keith Haring, and Leaves of Grass II: a book/by Bob Witz (1972). Witz, along other writers represented in the Downtown collection (Ron Kolm and Tom Savage, 1948- ), is also closely associated with the Unbearables literary group.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Bob Witz Papers/Appearances Magazine Collection (MSS 080) consists of material related to Appearances Magazine, correspondence, gallery catalogues and ephemera, sketchbooks, writings, chap books, drawings, and photographs.

Material related to Appearances Magazine includes notebooks compiled by Witz over his years as publisher of the magazine. Included within the notebooks are poems, drawings, phone numbers, and other assorted items. Other material related to the magazine include some financial and business records, submissions of writing and artwork, production files, and Appearances Press publications.
The collection also contains other materials collected by Witz including writings of his own and others, and additional notebooks, some from before the beginning of the magazine, and sketchbooks.

The collection includes both professional and personal correspondence. Among the correspondence are numerous exhibition announcements from various galleries around New York City and elsewhere. In addition to gallery ephemera there are also some exhibition catalogs from various galleries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The original donation and 2009 accretion have been arranged into three series: Appearances, Correspondence, and Miscellaneous.
Other accretions to the collections have been added as separate series. The materials in these accretions are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material at the Fales Library and Special Collections

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Items written by Witz (Leaves of Grass II, Berserker, and the Unbearable Manual of Style) are available to view at the Fales Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The original donation and 2009 accretion to the collection were arranged into series in 1997 and 2012. In 2017 multiple accretions were added to the collection as individual series; materials were re-housed in acid free folders and boxes described but no other arrangement and description has been done.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The series consists primarily of notebooks compiled by Witz over his years as publisher of the magazine. Included within the notebooks are poems, drawings, phone numbers, and other assorted items. Also included in the series are financial documents and artwork from the magazine, as well as notebooks from before the beginning of the magazine.

did.unittitle: Appearances Notebook - Issue #12, 13, 14 and Ads - n.d.
Appearances Notebook - Issue #15 Ads; Show - Speed Limit 55 - n.d.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of correspondence between Witz and others, both personal and professional. Organization is alphabetical.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The series contains other materials collected by Witz including writings of his own and others, and additional notebooks apparently unrelated to Appearances.

did.unittitle: Publications by Others - I read it... -
Appearances - gallery / artist cards and flyers
American Legion Junior Baseball Certificate of Eligibility

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accretion contains Bob Witz's sketchbooks (1974-1997), Stencil Novel (1978-1980), chapbooks (undated), submissions to Appearances Magazine, photographs, correspondence (1983-1997), newspapers (1970-1972), catalogues and ephemera from galleries (1983-1997). The accretion includes notes and writings by Bobby Joe Burbridge (late 1960s - early 1970s), and writing by Julie Gross.

did.unittitle: Sketchbooks, Chapbooks, Photographs, Correspondence, Newspapers; Notes and Writings by Bobby Joe Burbridge, D.A. Levy and Julie Gross; Gallery Catalogues and Ephemera
Sketchbooks, Photographs, Gallery Catalogues, Stencil Novel 1-4, and Beriah Wall Clay Tokens
Stencil Novel 5-15, Correspondence, Ephemera, and Sketches

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accretion contains a copy of Paul Lamarre's EIDIA Manifesto printed on a napkin, Appearances Magazine correspondence, including catalogues and gallery ephemera (1986-2005), and personal correspondence (1988-1990).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accretion contains Bob Witz's sketchbook (undated).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accretion contains Bob Witz's drawings and sketchbooks (undated), correspondence including gallery catalogues and ephemera (1974-2008), press releases and writing by Witz (1989-1992).

did.unittitle: Sketchbooks, Chapbooks, Photographs, Correspondence, Newspapers; Notes and Writings by Bobby Joe Burbridge, D.A. Levy and Julie Gross; Gallery Catalogues and Ephemera
Sketchbooks, Photographs, Gallery Catalogues, Stencil Novel 1-4, and Beriah Wall Clay Tokens

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accretion contains professional and personal correspondence (1977-2008), gallery catalogues and ephemera (1977-2008), submissions of writing and photographs to Appearances Magazine (undated, 1982, 1999, 2002-2010) and some Appearances production files, Appearances Press publications (1981-1986), a typescript of Don't Wait; Or, Wait, a novel by Robert Witz (undated), Bob Witz's sketchbooks (undated, 1990-2013) and some business records (circa 1980-1986) including Appearances certificate of incorporation (1983) and a list of subscribers (undated). There are also seven small flat round objects (1980s).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accretion contains Bob Witz's financial records, correspondence, exhibition and performance announcements and submissions to Appearances Magazine.

did.unittitle: Financial Records, Correspondence, Exhibition/Performance Announcements, and Submissions to Appearance Magazine

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accretion contains correspondence (2014), exhibition announcements (1990-2014), and gallery catalogues (2000-2014) particularly of Beatrice Caracciolo exhibitions.
